conversations.content: The Power of Music: Part One
One day, Giovanni—a dragon composer of considerable repute—took on a human pupil.
This disciple was rather timid and milquetoast, but his passion for music was without equal.
From the bottom of his heart, Giovanni looked forward to hearing the music that his talented pupil might create.   But one day...
＂Alas, what shall I do, Master Giovanni? I can no longer continue my study of music.＂
Upon hearing these words, the normally gentle Giovanni flew into a fury. What could be taking music away from his promising student?
＂The kingdom has told me I must go to war,＂ continued the student, ＂but I don't want to. I am afraid, and I don't want to die in battle. Please, Master Giovanni! Fight with me!＂
The pupil knew Giovanni valued his music, and was hoping the dragon would be angered at the thought of losing it and so agree to aid him in this matter.
For though Giovanni was a musician, he was still a dragon—and were he to join the war, it could be ended in a single battle.
But Giovanni shook his head at the request. ＂I'm a composer, not a warrior! I don't want to fight!＂
Giovanni immediately rejected the idea, without even a moment's hesitation. ＂You insensitive cur!＂ responded the student. ＂How can you not care what happens to your prize pupil?!＂
No matter how much the pupil screamed, Giovanni was unmoved. ＂I just want to enjoy music! I've no interest in fighting!＂
＂You're a fool for your music!＂ screamed the pupil as he stormed out of the conservatory. ＂A thrice-damned fool!＂
Giovanni gazed sadly at a piece of sheet music he had left behind, and heaved a deep sigh. ＂I wish I could have heard more of his music...＂
As the beautiful music faded from his life, the rough thump of military boots replaced it.

title: The Power of Music: Part One

conversations.content: The Power of Music: Part Two
The pupil who had quarreled with Giovanni stood quavering in his assigned army post. Would the war begin tomorrow? The day after?
His head was filled not with joyous music and song, but with thoughts of terror.
He recalled how his teacher refused to fight because he was a composer, not a warrior, and realized he was the same.
He hugged his knees to his chest and tried to still the rampant beating of his heart as the time for battle grew ever closer.
The drumbeat of horse hooves. The disciplined march of boots. The deep bellows of the commanders. The high-pitched glissando of drawn swords. But then...
＂GREETINGS! THE TIME HAS COME FOR SOME WONDERFUL MUSIC!＂
Giovanni landed between the two armies, accompanied by his fellow orchestra members! Needless to say, all the soldiers on the battlefield were dumbfounded.
＂Instead of engaging in bloody murder, all of you should give in to our wonderful music. Now then, our first song is a cantata, so let's showcase my singing voice!＂

The orchestra began to play music in time with Giovanni's conducting. Soon, the world was filled with the sound of the nautilus's jovial horn, the jellyfish's rhythmic timpani, and the ray's wondrous string ensemble.
But Giovanni's singing rose above it all. Though powerful, it was also light and airy, and it was clear the dragon was enjoying himself immensely.
Upon hearing it, ally and enemy alike were captivated. And after a few strains, the former pupil could huddle in silence no longer. ＂I wish to love music as well!＂ he cried.
Thus did the man begin to sing in harmony with Giovanni. Their song spread steadily, causing the soldiers—friend and foe alike— to join them as a great chorus.
＂The great power of music is to wash away malice and hatred!＂
In this way, the war was ended before it could begin—but the pupil still did not understand. ＂You said you did not wish to fight, Master, but you still came to the battlefield. Why?＂
＂Ah,＂ murmured Giovanni. ＂We did not come here to fight, but to share our appreciation of music! And in holding a concert on the battlefield, the war was ended. That is all.＂
＂And thanks to the power of music, I still have my most prized pupil.＂ Giovanni smiled as he said these words, and the man realized music had saved him.
＂Master! I swear to study hard and become a great composer just like you!＂  ＂Bravo! Now THAT I shall look forward to!＂
A few years later, the pupil invented a new art form that fused song with theater and named it opera. All hail the power of music!

title: The Power of Music: Part Two
